website_summaries.verdict: A 24-inch blade makes this heavy-duty model ideal for post-storm clean-ups and whole tree removal. Keep plenty of fuel on hand, however.
pros: Designed for heavy-duty cutting jobs with large limbs
cons: Hard to restart with hot engine

customer_reviews.title: Completely stopped working in 6 weeks  :(
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, without a problem, for 6 weeks. Turned off normally. Refueled. Tried to restart. Dead. No warning. No odd sound or performance. Never worked again. Contacted Husqvarna through website per their warranty instructions, no reply. Called twice and left messages at closest service and warranty repair shop listed on their website, no reply. Sigh. Had multiple friend's, loggers, recommend Stihl brand. Should have listened. Husqvarna was appx $100 less for comparable (we thought) product. Not worth the downtime and headache. Sad. :(
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: Since I am anonymous, I will admit that I accidentally put the chain on the wrong way. This saw is beautiful, heavy, a work of art. Buy the breeches, ear and eye protection and learn to hold it correctly because it's also a tool of death. If you need a lifetime chainsaw, this is it. We have 60 acres of mature trees and it is perfect for heavy duty work. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy somewhere local so you can return if needed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut up an oak that fell in my backyard several days ago. I received it yesterday. The box appeared unopened, but there was no chain inside. Amazon won't let me return it for some reason, and I don't recall being made aware of that at the time of purchase. Also, they dropped the price $40 two days after I bought it. Finally, the chain cover that shipped with it is too short - probably for a 20 inch. Oh well. I'll work it all out, but it's been a poor experience so far. Caveat emptor, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Parks

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this Item over Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday evening unpacked today, went to put chain on and noticed it was already run. Looked further and clutch spring is half broke. Then looked at date and it’s already 8 years old. Tried to get a hold of manufacturer but spent a few hours listening to crappy music. Tried sending message no answer. I was a little perturbed so I went to return item on Amazon, cost over 500 dollars. Amazon says Item can’t be returned. I know Covid 19 effects service but with this is experience I’m adopt ready to quit Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Preston Saunders

customer_reviews.title: A real heavy duty winner
customer_reviews.text: This is a awesome chainsaw. I am glad we got it for our neighbor had 2 huge pine trees fall during a recent storm. My husband was the hero of the day when he brought this bad boy to the party. Great item and the shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: amy o

customer_reviews.title: Removing clutch plate warning
customer_reviews.text: It is disappointing that the chainsaw can be an issue if not familiar with disassembly of it or not reading owner manual. Be careful. Make sure break is not locked before removing clutch plate. An improvement would be if the manufacturer included a large warning tag of this sort. Also the brake handle gear is made of plastic. I tried to reset the clutch as others have done using brake handle. The clutch plate barely gripoed the handle gear so the handle gear plastic stripped out. It should be metal gear on brake handle as a a backup for resetting the clutch plate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chainsaw!!
customer_reviews.text: A great saw! I grew up in Maine, my dad used a Husqvarna daily in the woods. Bought this saw as my dad recommend it; as a good saw for what I needed, cutting up red oak and white oak downed from a tornado in the N GA mountains. Just cut up 4, 60ft oaks. This thing is a beast, it did not spudder once with a 30" oak. Will see how it preforms with the alaskan saw.. will update.
customer_reviews.author: Daysend

customer_reviews.title: Best Saw I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Starts up EASY, runs very smooth and has TONS of cutting power. I bought this for some large cuts I needed to make then ended up trying it with a smaller bar for some other stuff. It's by far the best saw I've used. Keep it oiled and chains sharp and it runs like new each time. Lots of convenience features - kick break, auto switch on the choke, vibration dampener... Definitely worth the money. Shipped fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Terry

customer_reviews.title: Beastvarna
customer_reviews.text: This is a great residential chainsaw for people who have a lot of wood but a regular sized bar won’t do. I have a lot of cut down stumps in my yard and I needed something hefty. This is not a go to Lowe’s and buy saw. It’s a large saw for large trees and lots of big jobs. The saw weighs 25lbs or so and you feel it. I like how easy it is to clean and take apart. I would suggest subbing out the stock chain for an H47 chain as it will make your cutting much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Saw works good, original chain was not good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am modifying my original review. I bought an "Oregon" brand chain and it worked MUCH better that the stock chain. Original stock chain didn't stay sharp for more then about 15 minutes. Had it professionally re-sharpened, same problem, dull after about 15 minutes. Oregon chain stayed sharp for an incredibly long time, once re-sharpened, it is staying sharp for a long time again. Something weird about chain installation on the saw. After installing original (junk) chain and Oregon chain, the saw wouldn't start. A dealer had to get it started both times. Once I got the right brand chain and the dealer got it running, it has been working good ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: The chain saw came without the adjustment screw for the chain tension installed.
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw came without the adjustment screw for the chain tension installed. This is not a part that is installed at first use.It is designed to be installed at the factory. No customer support available by phone and no response received by email. Over $500 spent and it is totally useless to me and what I need to be doing. Next time I will buy a Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Zero complaints. The saw is great and starts right up. In one afternoon I downed and sectioned out three trees before the blades seemed to be getting dull.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: 24 Inches of Badass!
customer_reviews.text: I have used chain saws since I was in the teens and because of grandpa I was partial to Stihl. NOT anymore. This saw is awesome all the way around. Although at 24" it is heavy but the power is great. The chain has lasted longer than any chain I have ever used so I bought 3 more. Replacement parts seem relatively cheap also. This 460 Rancher is a worthy buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, but wish i read directions better
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, but wish i read directions better. I Never disengaged the chain brake before pulling off the cover to install on the bar and chain and there is no turning back. Ended up having to take out the spring for the brake entirely and there is no getting it back. Lesson learned for my next chain saw purchase. But other than that, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret buying this one
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I've ever made! My husband was against gas chainsaws and didn't care for large bars. We compromised and got this one to take trees down. My husband thanked me for talking him into this one because any smaller, it would've taken forever. He also said he was glad it was lighter than he thought it was going to be. We both are very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: ... saws in the past and I was not very happy with their performance
customer_reviews.text: I've had cheap chain saws in the past and I was not very happy with their performance. Now I have some large trees in the back that need cleaned up and I wanted a good saw to do the job. After some research here and on CR, I decided on the Husqvarna. I'm very happy with it so far. It cut through a fallen 22" oak like butter. Lot's of power yet very smooth. I've never had a decent saw before and the difference is incredible. Great saw, but be sure to work safely with anything this powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lee

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna Chain Saw Rabcher 460:
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this chain saw. East start didn't have any trouble using the pressure release valve. I know I will enjoy my tree felling much more now. The 24" blade will come in handy for cutting gants lumber from logs. I will recommend this chain saw to all my friends and family in need of a new Chain saw. Sincerely, Rev. Joseph
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service nonexistent-problems with saw  right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Before I write this review let me say that I have substantial experience using chainsaws having owned two chainsaws and using chainsaws routinely while working for the fire department. Having discovered an issue right out of the box - I attempted to contact Husqvarna on its toll free number only to wait over an hour-speaking to no one and hanging up in frustration. Not sure if the saw was a return from another customer but I’m considering sending it back and looking at other brand options. I have no patience for substandard post purchase customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power and starts easy, just every time the chain comes off bar it messes up about a foot and a half of the drive links on the chain. I’ve filed and put on bench grinder and still can’t get the chain to ride on bar. Never had this problem before, never had chain ruined by coming off bar. What’s up, saw this on another review and thought it was fluke. Same thing is happening. I’m on my 3rd chain on about fills os gas.
customer_reviews.author: Harold L. DuBose

customer_reviews.title: Big trees are no match for the Rancher 460
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a 35 year old Green Machine that I bought new. 2HP and weighs 9lbs it’s getting tired now. I bought the Rancher 460 just under 4HP and 12 lbs . WOW what a chain saw. This baby cuts and cuts like nothing I have seen before. I don’t mind the extra weight in fact it’s really not noticeable. Because of the power of this saw you don’t get warn out as quickly it does make a difference. Big trees are down quick I would say in 2/3 the time that it use to take with my old saw.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Rogge Sr

customer_reviews.title: Cutting right through my husbands honey do list.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw for my husband and he is thrilled with it. He is cutting down everything in sight! One way to get the honey do list whittled down! He says it starts every time. Cuts through the big stuff like butter. He’s already working on the third cord of firewood for next winter! He did a lot of research before he chose this saw and I’m so glad we were able to order it here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY L NORRBOM

customer_reviews.title: The saw is fine, but I did not get what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 24 inch .058 gauge and that is what I thought I received. However, I tried to change the chain today and the new one did not fit. Come to find out that instead of the .058 gauge bar, I actually received the 24 inch .050 gauge bar. So the 3 .058 gauge chains I bought do not fit. Fortunately, I also bought a 20 bar for this saw, so my day was not wasted. Let's see if Amazon can deal with this to my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGraw

customer_reviews.title: Technology education is better than art.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw with excellent power and startup. I ran a 455 with an 18" bar for about 10 years and this is noticeably more powerful and has better features than the older models. I mounted this saw on an Alaskan sawmill and have already cut about 50 slabs in a month or two. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Tech Ed is better than art

customer_reviews.title: This bad boy is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy is a beast. maybe a bit of exaggeration but I love it. I've had chainsaws before but usually 30 cc. this guy is twice that. I'm using it to cut up trees for fire wood and right out of the box she scream through trees. first tree I picked up this season guy had the comparable Stihl and it struggled to get through this ash tree. This beast blew through the same tree in half the time and didn't break a sweat. I wanted to buy a chainsaw for life and "knock on wood" this baby will be with me for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: houston williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts like a dream. I also bought a 20" bar and chain thinking that it might be under powered with the 24" bar. I was so wrong. This thing is a beast. My only complaint is that the chain seems to come lose pretty frequently. Maybe I'm not tightening the nuts down enough, as I have not put a torque wrench on them, but I am afraid that I might strip the threads if I tighten any further. Maybe it's just me. Great saw overall though. I've cut some big ponderosa pines and it just cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.author: SJR

customer_reviews.title: First new saw, not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Haven't gotten THAT much use out of it yet. The timber I have taken down has given me a very good favorable impression of the saw. When compared to an older saw from a different maker, this (larger) saw has plenty of power and will get through anything I have tried it on...... Professional grade?? Not sure, but sure seems like it will do a great job for pretty much anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic saw
customer_reviews.text: this saw is fantastic. cut down 6 trees in a very short time. found nothing that it would not handle. easy set up and started with only a few pulls of the cord at first start. starts easy after running for some time as well. I don't get numb hands or get tired as like it did with other saws. Its a beast and will handle most or any job you have on trees. will definitely recommend this to any one that is needing a chain saw. Don't monkey around with small saws if you want to get the job done get this unit... 460//24" FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.author: Les Baxter

customer_reviews.title: It’s a BEAST!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is all the chainsaw you will ever need, unless your a lumberjack for a living. I admit I was a little worried about buying such a big saw that it would be really heavy, it’s not at all for the size of it. Right out of the box three pulls and it fired right up....like the title says; ITS A BEAST!!!!!! I am very happy with it, it’s been used a lot in the month I have had with zero issues. If you are looking for a very good saw with plenty of power and a very reasonable price this is the one I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Heavy for a plastic saw
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for its displacement and power. Plastic construction in the design is even in the bar mount area and engine frame. Unlike less expensive and lighter echo saws made of magnesium in those areas. Maybe the plastic holds up? I can't say because I haven't broken it under heavy use yet....so time will tell. I have maybe 20 hours cutting. No complaints other than the weight
customer_reviews.author: Jegs911

customer_reviews.title: A Beast!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Husky 440 series but I have some trees I need to take out that are just too big for that saw. This saw dwarfs the 440 and makes it seem like a kid's toy. It made short work of some big oaks I had behind the house. It is also very easy to start, and to tension the chain. You won't be disappointed by this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Askew

customer_reviews.title: One Bad Mojo Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this chainsaw. However, PLEASE BE AWARE! ALWAYS install a new chain after 6 or 8 hours of heavy use.. This chainsaw, just like all others, will not cut through butter with a dull chain.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: A Total Beast
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this purchase. Easy start - hot or cold. Powerful and well balanced. Made over 20 cuts of a 22+" poplar without needing to even sharpen the chain. With my 18" Husqvarna I needed to sharpen the chain after 2 cuts. Not sure if the improvement is due to the larger chain or more power, but this thing is amazing. Should have purchased years ago.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Starts Right Up Right Out Of Box!
customer_reviews.text: Everythig is as advertised. I was surprised how lite it is. And the vibration dampening is amazing. It's a smooth running yet powerful saw, a bit of a gentleman compared to my Stihl 034 Super AV. I am running it with a 36" Oregon bar as I have several large trees to deal with. It has plenty of power to run the 24" bar that it came with and still works well with the 36" Oregon bar. If you are on the fence about this saw go ahead and buy it you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: shawn m martin

customer_reviews.title: Not originally flagged as non returnable even if defective...
customer_reviews.text: My first Husqvarna. Owned Poulons for 35 years. They're garbage now, won't buy another one. My son has owned a Rancher 455 for over 4 years. He loves it and when I've used it was equally impressed. I purchased the Rancher 460 and upon attempting to install the bar a part popped out that I think is part of the chain brake mechanism. Not sure if this unit was already a return but I am disappointed. My son broght his saw over to compare and see if we could put it back together. No luck. Now being told by Amazon that it's not returnable... Bought a lot of extra components, case, bars, chains, tanks, oil, wedges etc.....
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Worst saw I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This saw has been a pain to use the entire time I have owned it. It starts hard and won’t stay running if you do manage to start it. I thought I would give husqvarna a try to see if it was comparable to a Stihl and that has been my biggest mistake. I own a Stihl and I am getting rid of this POS husqvarna and never looking back. Avoid the headache of owning husqvarna and buy a Stihl!
customer_reviews.author: Sean M

customer_reviews.title: I recommend everyone buying this chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is awesome it's strong it cut a log 5' L & 1' W with no problems. The second photo was when I try to cut that log with a 16 in chainsaw and could not do it because the wood was too hard. In the third photo I suggest you by the case it's extra but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: Mine runs like junk. All other husqies I ran were amazing, that’s why I bought mine. Takes forever to warm up, and even then (with a nice sharp chain) still feels sluggish. My friend has the exact same one that just rips through anything. I’ve only used husqi pre mix fuel as well. Super bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: I have multiple 460 rancher's I had to modify this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple 460 rancher's I had to modify this one because the chain break was not mounted properly so I kept walking out the store was in use ordered new parts of venturing I just had to disable the chain break in order to use the saw
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Super product. Would highly recommend for the price. Note it does take a bit to get it started the first time. My arm was hanging off in frustration but thankfully after getting it going once it works well now
customer_reviews.author: MR T DEXTER

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to do a juniper cutting project and I have not been disappointed! It has the power and starts every time. I already worn out one bar and ran the crap out of it. So far only a clogged fuel vent has slowed me down for a few days. This was not the saws fault as when you use them it is usually going to get dirty! Buy this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... this was the one that fit our needs the best (thank you consumer reports)
customer_reviews.text: We researched chain saws a lot and this was the one that fit our needs the best (thank you consumer reports). The price on Amazon was the best we could find, and we have now used the chain saw for several weeks. Many, many trees later ... we are still super happy with this chain saw. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: It’s a beast
customer_reviews.text: Best chain saw I have ever owned, took down a pine tree like a champ. Never bogged down, starts by the second pull. Delivery was just fast. If your looking for a 24 in bar, this is the saw to drive it.
customer_reviews.author: Ebray

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This is the first brand-new chainsaw I've ever owned. The others that I've had were very powerful and long-lasting, but this one blows them all away. It is easy to start, easy to run and does a number on the biggest trees I could throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Quality, dependable, works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how long the 24" bar was for my needs so I ordered a 20" bar and chain. Works perfect without losing horsepower. Starts fast and easy, cuts well, great quality in comparison to other top brands. Would recommend, if you can afford it. The price is in line with other name brands but is hard to come by for the common working man. Parts are readily available, but if taken care of, will last and function for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: SB in NC

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic saw. Have worked it hard since the day it arrived. Cuts through Tamarack like a hot knife through- well, it cuts really well. Don't push the bulb as many times as it says. If it won't start, try turning off the choke.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderbolt

customer_reviews.title: tree monster
customer_reviews.text: Wow......Great product that loves to eat trees!!!! just b4 Irma hit i had three trees i needed down bc they were dead. This company got it too me in a day and i had time to spare to cut the trees down...this machine loves to eat
customer_reviews.author: Al Capone

customer_reviews.title: Not reccommended for sawmilling.
customer_reviews.text: You can purchase this saw for in the states but if you need a ripping chain you cannot find one as they aren't intended to be used here, per Husqvarna. As we contacted them trying to find one.
customer_reviews.author: kim Dyrdahl

customer_reviews.title: Qaulity Product
customer_reviews.text: This Husqvarna 460 Rancher is strong and powerful. If you have used the store brand chainsaws before be prepared for a new experience in power when you put this baby to work. It's durable and powerful making the work go fast. It's not your wimpy light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P Diggs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality at a great price. It is definitely up for the challenge.
customer_reviews.text: The Husqvarna 460 is the perfect amount of horsepower and strength without moving into an industrial model for trees. Works great and you don't have to be a lumberjack to use it. Awesome quality, great price. The assembly instructions could use a little work.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: I read it would be difficult to start, I ...
customer_reviews.text: I read it would be difficult to start, I took a chance. Well it's true. But after a couple of days of trying it starts! Performed perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: unit is still being operated in it recommended break in period and procedure recommended by Husqvarna
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in Original OEM box, all items were present and intact and brand new. unit is still being operated in it recommended break in period and procedure recommended by Husqvarna. Upon delivery the unit was set up and tested for function. No issues. The factory chain (this applies to any chainsaw chain manufacture) cuts better after its first sharpening. Performs well. Unit with fuel and bar oil is about 15 lbs, That is pretty good balance for a good saw.
customer_reviews.author: Capt J. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 460 Rancher
customer_reviews.text: The Husky 460 Rancher is a bit heavy but for the job it’s required to do you'd expect weight. It is one powerful cutting machine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: A beast of a chainsaw! An awesome value, the best price I could find on an amazing saw. I'm not experienced with saws at all, read the startup procedures and followed them with no issues I was doing the work that needed to be done when the saw arrived (earlier than expected having just selected standard free shipping). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: nuke

customer_reviews.title: Good product. One small flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Love its cutting ability and power but kick back brake release spring is way too tight and keeps brake engaged even with handle pulled back, causes overheating and wear top brake and clutch flywheel. Perfect size and weight for a large chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wood Beast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sick. It's also a pretty good value. Plus Husqvarna is a pretty cool town, and the neighboring town of Jonkoping is also pretty cool and has one of the best pizza places in the world called The Evergreen. I hope it's still there. I'd recommend the kebab pizza with extra kebab sauce and slaw on top. Truly a fantastic chainsaw tho.
customer_reviews.author: Watson

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design
customer_reviews.text: My second AND Last Husky. I understand how the brake mechanism works and that it needs to be off when you remove the cover however all of the pieces internally that control the brake are cheap plastic and it's something that you have to deal with on a regular basis when you use a chainsaw and it's just very poorly designed next time Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Elaine Wood

customer_reviews.title: It's great but leaks
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast, but leaks oil from the chain oil gasket constantly. If I could get a gasket or 2 thrown in with the purchase, it would have made it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Product Description - not .058 Gauge Bar
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to use, but ordered a .058 ripping chain to use with the saw and saw mill. That chain doesn't fit on the .050 gauge bar (ref pic) that came with the saw. The saw's product description says .058 gauge chain (ref pic). You should correct that.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis B.

customer_reviews.title: Beast mode Saw
customer_reviews.text: Length is great, easy to start, cuts almost anything like butter as long as you have a sharp blade.
customer_reviews.author: Archserver

customer_reviews.title: exactly what she wanted
customer_reviews.text: this was given as a gift and my cousin was completely thrilled. It was exactly what she wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Cindyhasitall

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough. My get a shorter bar.
customer_reviews.text: Runs like a scalded dog but I think I would like the reduced mechanical load of a shorter bar and chain. I keep the long setup for when I need it but this thing would shred like crazy with a 20” bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw, starts every time!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a number of chainsaws. I needed a larger one to clear oak trees in my yard after hurricane Harvey. If you follow the starting steps that Husqvarna recommends then this saw starts every time, even when you don't want it to! Can't speak to longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Brad James

customer_reviews.title: Sub par packaging
customer_reviews.text: The saw is great works awesome the packaging was submitted par!! Received very fast however when I opened it the included 2 cycle oil bottle was punctured oil everywhere.... I understand it's a chainsaw and it will get dirty but after spending the $$$ I would've at least liked to be the one to do it
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Monstah, it ripps
customer_reviews.text: Powerful enough to handle a 24"bar for occasional use. Couldn't say how long it would last as an everyday saw but my 455 Rancher is tough as nails with a 20"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent 24inch chainsaw for price
customer_reviews.text: A good saw for average large limb cutting. Could be a bit more powerful, trouble with large dense logs. Difficulty with chain brake mechanism while installing and adjusting the chain seems common with the model judging by the YouTube tutorials to fix it. Dependable Husqvarna motor and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Easy starting!
customer_reviews.text: Makes quick work of even the biggest of logs. Order a few extra chains to have on hand though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I love this chainsaw. It is an absolute beast, and perfect for my needs. We have a lot of trees on my property, and this chainsaw makes for quick easy work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew White

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our farmette
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our farmette! My husband loves it!... offers to cut up trees for all of our friends its so nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chainsaw and easy to operate. Got the 24” bar by mistake which is way more than I needed. Works perfect with 20” bar as the chain stays tighter than with the 24”. Easy to start and change bar/chains.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.K., Sr.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: Great all around saw. You can view as many reviews as you want, bottom line is that this saw out performs others in its class. I’ve owned other brands, this saw is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong motor and quick cut
customer_reviews.text: Husband is happy with performance great speed and cuts wonderful
customer_reviews.author: cubby

customer_reviews.title: awesome saw, makes light work of decent size trees
customer_reviews.text: awesome saw, makes light work of decent size trees. ive cut several pines and some oaks with it and havent had any problems , i run the vp pre mixed fuel from tractor supply and it runs great.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: It is a big girl. She requires a mans man to handle her.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Klipp Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I decided to take the plunge and invest in ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a beast; zipped right through a healthy oak 19 1/2" in diameter that a wind storm had knocked down. The anti-vibration technology in this thing has been a lifesaver for my shoulders, and the decompression valve makes restarting it a breeze. So glad I decided to take the plunge and invest in a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: John Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Have had this saw for about 2 months now. Used it a handful of times and love it. Good power and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: tig

customer_reviews.title: living offgrid in the woods with no chainsaw now
customer_reviews.text: I used the money had to get a top line chainsaw to help me build offgrid. i bought in may 2019 and used 5 times by sept. now it doesnt start. I took care of it and use proper gas. It is now past the return date. So im out of $500 and no chainsaw. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: robert k.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and will last you a lifetime if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Put the saw together, followed the quick start instructions, and started cutting wood. Great saw and will last you a lifetime if you take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Saw for Cutting Trees
customer_reviews.text: We had to cut several larger oak trees on our property recently. This saw made the job easier when it came to the larger trees; very impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Jane A

customer_reviews.title: great saw!
customer_reviews.text: absolute beast. this was cheaper than the one with the 20" bar for some reason. The 20" bar makes it much more balanced and easy to handle. put the 24" on when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great machine.
customer_reviews.text: Got one tank of gas out of it, would not start. Cleaned sparkplug, changed gas/oil, still nothing. Went to local Husqvarna servicing dealer- he walked me though proper starting procedure- only TWO pulls while on full choke- otherwise, engine floods. Been a rockstar ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Love this chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice chainsaw. Easy to control and plenty of power. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: David Jones

customer_reviews.title: Rancher 460 24-inch is a great saw.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this saw. After assembly it started right up, oiled properly and cut well. It is light but has little kickback. I have other Husqvarna saws but needed a 24 inch for a big cleanup job. This saw did the job with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hart

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 460
customer_reviews.text: Too much plastic on it, but it runs/starts well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Raieo

customer_reviews.title: Chain/bar oiler sucks! No servicing dealer amazon won’t except returns
customer_reviews.text: Super powerful saw motor is great but chain/bar doesn’t oil. Motor pumps oil but nothing reaches the end of the bar (from unboxing no cutting) Buyer beware amazons amazing returns don’t apply here and good luck finding a local servicing dealer...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easiest starting chainsaw I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Ready to cut wood right out of box. 24 inch bar is perfect for those jobs that are just too big for my everyday chainsaw. Been running it in temps averaging around 10 f and starts and runs easily every time. My other Husqvarna I’ve been running near 22 years.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Land

customer_reviews.title: It is all it is ment to be
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I have owned many saws in the past years and find this saw is worth every penny. I recommend this all very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want a quality chainsaw, purchase a Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.text: The Husqvarna 460 Rancher with 24 inch guide is a great chain saw. It started on the 3rd pull.
customer_reviews.author: jimstar

customer_reviews.title: We just needed to clean up our 2 acres but he says it starts amazingly easy and cuts like a champ
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this saw. We just needed to clean up our 2 acres but he says it starts amazingly easy and cuts like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Birt

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about this saw it does a awesome job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes fast work of even large trees
customer_reviews.text: Quality tool. Starts faster than my Stihl and has more power.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hope

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Husqvarna Quality is hard to beat. Good power--just cut up a 75 foot Oak with it. Had a 20 inch Husqvarna that was a bit small. This one was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to start, and has a good discharge. It makes quick work sawing through logs.
customer_reviews.author: the hawk

customer_reviews.title: I know this saw will give me years of valuable service and make me money!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a Huskyfan and this chain saw continues my confidence in their products, good power and balance easy to operate. Like how safe and less noise compared to my older saw. I would say if you need a new saw you can't go wrong buying this saw, value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: jeff app

customer_reviews.title: great brand
customer_reviews.text: didn't exactly need 24 inch , but not much different in price from 20 inch so might as well go for the gusto !
customer_reviews.author: Ron R. Jacomen

customer_reviews.title: A good backup saw
customer_reviews.text: Harder to start then my Echo 600P, and takes three times as long to change a chain. OK for a backup saw but wouldn't be my saw of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Wehri

customer_reviews.title: Easy start cuts clean
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a long blade! Chainsaw starts with ease and cuts thick hard wood like butter.
customer_reviews.author: NeBirdLady

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Badass Saw made with a 24 inch bar hands down very hard to stall cut so fast and starts the same
customer_reviews.author: Deano74

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: I’m a saw enthusiast. This thing provides ample power to see your way through whatever you lay it in. Don’t overspend and be disappointed. I finally Saw the light and this product just simply gets the job done. Easy to start and simple to maintain. Great for the do it YS or everyday pro. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnut42

customer_reviews.title: Paul Bunyon would want one
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast. Little heavy but if you are going after big hardwood. You want a tool like this. Easy to start easy to operate but does have a ton of power.
customer_reviews.author: aaron snow

customer_reviews.title: You can cut like a lumberjack!!
customer_reviews.text: High quality and runs every time. Easy to start, powerful and you can smash some trees with this workhorse!!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Hester

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 24 Inch 460 Rancher Gas Chainsaw
product_meta.description: Size:24 in. - .058 in. GaugeThe ergonomic design of The Husqvarna 24" 460 Rancher gas chainsaw allows the homeowner to handle the power of the saw with ease. Powerful, yet easy to start thanks to smart start technology, This gas powered chainsaw is ready to cut trees, whether you need to prune, limb or cut firewood. The air injection centrifugal air cleaning system helps keep larger dust & debris particles from reaching the air filter, to improve engine life. The lowvib anti-vibration system reduces vibration levels, for more comfortable chainsaw operation. Maximum power speed : 9000 rpm
feature_bullets: 460 Rancher chainsaw is a robust all-round saw for jobs that need a longer Bar
60. 3cc 24 inch gas chainsaw with guide bar and chain
2 cycle engine with intertia activated chain brake for safety while operating. Oil tank volume - 0.7 US pint. Oil pump capacity Max - 17 ml/min. Oil pump capacity Min - 6 ml/min
Orange Husqvarna chainsaw Bar cover and 2. 6 ounce 2 cycle fuel Included, Bar and chain oil must be purchased Separately
Automatic chain oiler delivers a steady supply of bar and chain oil for safe and effective use
Simple, side-mounted chain tensioning system allows for quick chain adjustments while working
The quick-release air filter facilitates easy cleaning and replacement of the air filter
Husqvarna chainsaw with x-torque lowers fuel consumption and reduces emissions
For safety use with Husqvarna chainsaw chaps, chainsaw gloves and chainsaw helmet
Centrifugal air cleaning system removes larger dust and debris particles before reaching the air filter. This results in reduced air filter cleanings and improved engine life.
